Articles.Content: Hellooooo fellow Kerbanauts! ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif) How are you fine and wonderful people this lovely day/night? I have a question about mods (again ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)) This time I'm curious about environmental mods; mods that create a more realistic environment for a more immersive gaming experience. I have already downloaded OPM and Chatterer. I was wondering if a mod like the Astronomers pack has been developed for 1.0.2 yet? I looked in the mod inventory, but to no avail ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif). Any suggestions? Thanks!!!

Astronomers Pack is not available for 1.0.2 specifically, however some people have had limited success getting it running anyway. The older Edge of Oblivion version will just add the clouds but I've been having trouble with EVE crashing my game no matter what I do. It feels like a memory leak in 1.0 (i.e. works at first but inevitably crashes after running for a while), though not everybody seems to have the same issue.

[PlanetShine](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96497-0-25-1-0-2-PlanetShine-v0-2-3-1)is simply amazing.

[Engine Lighting](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121987-1-0-2-Engine-Lighting-%281-3%29-The-Jitter-Update-%2827-May%29) is coming along nicely.

Even if you don't install any visual packs, [Texture Replacer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107471-0-90-TextureReplacer-2-1-2-new-thread-the-old-one-is-broken) adds a few nice things all by itself including "safe condition" helmet removal and reflective helmet surfaces. It also lets you install a much nicer skybox and NavBall texture.

Being a game company does not magically make you good at all game visual coding. Clouds are a complex problem that can be solved in many ways, most of which would trigger the "not good enough" rants of our fine community.

> 
> Being a game company does not magically make you good at all game visual coding. Clouds are a complex problem that can be solved in many ways, most of which would trigger the "not good enough" rants of our fine community.

I feel that 'what isn't good enough' is not having clouds in the first place. EVE may have a few little issues that people might grumble about, but on balance it is far, far better to have it than not. Like others in this thread, I'm still unhappy that 1.0 was released with such a fundamental visual element missing.

I can't stand to look at the stock game anymore after playing with EVE, DOE, PlanetShine. Chatterer is pretty good too.
